text: Saudi Arabia has been in 12 Summer Olympic Games. They first were in the 1972 Summer Olympics in Munich, West Germany. They have been in the Winter Olympic Games since 2022. By Saudi Arabian law, women cannot be in the Olympic Games."Rice hopes Saudi women will soon compete in Olympics" , AFP, August 17, 2008 However, the International Olympic Committee is reportedly pressuring the Saudi Olympic Committee to send female athletes to the 2012 Summer Olympics."Saudi women vie for Olympic rights", BBC, June 13, 2008 Others want Saudi Arabia to not be in the Olympics unless they let women in."Qatar decision to send female athletes to London 2012 increases pressure on Saudi Arabia", Inside the Games, July 1, 2010 The Saudi Arabian Olympic Committee was formed in 1964 and recognized in 1965. ==Medalists== Medal Name Games Sport Event Hadi Al Somayli 2000 Sydney Athletics Men's 400 m hurdles Khaled Al Eid 2000 Sydney Equestrian Individual jumping Ramzy Al Duhami Abdullah Al Saud Kamal Bahamdan Abdullah Sharbatly 2012 London Equestrian Team jumping ==Related pages== * List of IOC country codes ==References== ==Other websites== * Saudi Arabia profile at London2012.com Category:Sport in Saudi Arabia Category:Nations at the Olympics
